sentences.english: Today play bullfight lose 1500 dollars depressing dead.
sentences.chinese: 今天打鬥牛輸啦1500塊錢鬱悶死了。

sentences.english: Everything I did or said displeased her, and I left depressed.
sentences.chinese: 我做的說的每件事都讓她不高興，這讓我很鬱悶。

sentences.english: He tried to break through the cloud of gloom hanging over his roomates with a joke.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖講句笑話打破籠罩着同室朋友間的鬱悶氣氛。

sentences.english: That unfinished list is already depressingly long.
sentences.chinese: 這位未完的清單已經令人鬱悶地長。

sentences.english: My holidays plan arrive village life, that will let me forget many annoyance.
sentences.chinese: 我假期策動到屯子生活，那會讓我忘卻許多鬱悶。

sentences.english: They were very different from her children's stories. They were about love, power, and unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 與她的兒童讀物非常不同，是有關愛，權力和鬱悶的。

sentences.english: Have a little this several days depressed, very stuffy, so absolutely go out to take a walk.
sentences.chinese: 這幾天有點鬱悶，悶得發慌，所以絕對出去逛逛。

sentences.english: This past week has been a particularly frustrating week. The internet has been so painfully slow.
She was silent, and I guessed at her unutterable depression.
sentences.chinese: 她不說話了，但我猜她有滿腔說不出的鬱悶。

sentences.english: Getting sunburnt on the first day sucks.
sentences.chinese: 入營第一天就被曬傷真讓人鬱悶。

sentences.english: He was silent, and i guessed at his unutterable depression .
sentences.chinese: 他不講話了，但我猜他有滿腔說不出的鬱悶。

sentences.english: I'm frustrated that I can't eat for two days.
sentences.chinese: 我兩天都不能喫飯了，我真鬱悶。

sentences.english: My in the mind is matchless and depressed, does the die fox have no incident person fashion why?
sentences.chinese: 我心裏無比鬱悶，死狐狸沒事變人樣幹嘛？

sentences.english: This looks depressingly right to me.
sentences.chinese: 在我看來，這種表述既正確，又令人鬱悶。

sentences.english: Even eating can be like that, the life is too depressed.
sentences.chinese: 喫東西都喫成那樣，過得也太鬱悶了。

definition: to feel unwell/to suffer pain/to be difficult to bear
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
